resources.string: Challenge your brain with daily training games anywhere you are
In this multitasking experiment, we compare performance when just doing one task compared to when two tasks are mixed.
Useful for: \n1. Carrying out multiple tasks at the same time like driving while talking on the phone \n2. Carrying out multiple tasks in rapid sequential order like cooking

You will be shown these four figures in sequential trials 
1. When on the top "Shape" space, you will classify them by the shape ONLY. 
2. When on the bottom "Filling" space, you will classify them by the the number of dots ONLY. 
3. On the mix challenge you will have to switch classification depending if the figure is at the top or bottom
See your progress on this task
Visual search is a type of perceptual task requiring attention that involves an active scan of the visual environment for a particular object among others
Useful for: \n1. Looking for your keys on the table before you leave \n2.Finding a friend in a large crowd of people

The goal of the game is to find the orange T as fast as possible. There will be blue Ts and upside down orange Ts to distract you. If there is an orange T, click "Found it" If there is no orange T, click "No Orange T"
Concentration is a type of visuo-spatial memory task that involves recalling and manipulating images to keep track of the location of moving objects
Useful for: \n1.Recalling where you saw things last in your apartment \n2.Better letter/number recognition when reading or performing arithmetic tasks
1.Click on the cards to reveal the icon \n2.Remember the position and icon of the card you saw \n3.Try to pair two cards with the same icon together to earn points
